ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Active servers?
ygData.msgSnippet: I am not on Drinal.  In fact, right now, I d say I m not even active.  My interest in MMORPGs seem to ebb and wane.  I lost interest in EQ for awhile and went
ygData.messageBody:
I am not on Drinal.  In fact, right now, I'd say I'm not even active.  My interest in MMORPGs seem to ebb and wane.  I lost interest in EQ for awhile and went to Lord Of the Rings Online.  Then I went back to EQ2 after Rise of Kunark came out.  I started a Sarnak Shadowknight named Dreadskar on the Antonia Bayle server.  I like the character well enough but then I stopped playing for a bit to record some music, and just haven't been back to playing either of the 3 games. 
 
I don't know.  I seem to have lost my interest in the 3 but I still keep my accounts in case I want to go back to them.  I'm not sure what would make me interested again, but this private server sounds like a neat deal.  It'd have to be free because to charge for it when it's not Sony sponmsored would be illegal I think. 
 
I just think there's been so much new content added to EQ since I've been away that now it'd be actually HARDER for me to play because I don't know all the new zones, all the new spells and quests, and there's a new learning curve I have to go through that even my highest level character (69 druid) would still be a newbie.  Just not even sure if it's worth my time any more.
 
 
Wulfric
 
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Thomas Houseman
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, March 13, 2008 7:34 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Active servers?

Well, speaking as another Drinal-ite.. ..
 
I regularly do /who 1 44 and a /who 44 80 in the guild lobby to see what number of people in each range are there and then MGB either Temperance or Temerity depending on which range have the higher numbers.
 
I'd say about 40% of the time it's the lvl 1 44 people that get temperance so there are quite a few newbie/alts running around.
 
T.
----- Original Message -----
From: D. Scott Smith
To: 'EverQuest@yahoogro ups.com'
Sent: Friday, March 14, 2008 9:25 AM
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Re: Active servers?

How is Drinal working for you. I'm looking to restart EQ and I want to jump to whatever server is the most noob friendly ( is that an oxymoron? ) Honestly, I'm also looking at an EQ Private Server called Shards of Dalaya as an option and it looks so fun! ( and free too ) but not Sony sponsored. I miss EQ but I really don't want to get into the 65+ stuff, just really want to relive the good times =)

Scott (Paria)
Yeah, I know, I'm one of those old farts... whatever.

-----Original Message-----
From: EverQuest@yahoogrou ps.com [mailto:EverQuest@yahoogrou ps.com] On Behalf Of Todd
Sent: Tuesday, January 15, 2008 12:35 AM
To: EverQuest@yahoogrou ps.com
Subject: [EverQuest] Re: Active servers?

Just the other day (Sat.) I logged back on to EQ and started a new
Beast Lord on the Drinal (formally Tarew Marr) server. I have
another friend that did the same. We managed to make level 20 in one
day with out twinking... Most of the time I will be on in the
mornings because I work nights so if you see a toon named "Drakeson"
go ahead and say Hi.. I'm looking forward to getting back into EQ
again..

Todd
